III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention Standards and Prohibitions
Section
Description
1

(1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/16/2025 staff hit youth in the shoulder.
Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/22/2025. Youth A reported she unplugged the TV due to not
liking what was on the TV and Staff 1 punched her in the back of
her right shoulder. Youth A reported there was a bruise on the
back of her right shoulder and her shoulder hurt because of Staff 1
punching her. Youth A reported she did not know if the bruise
was still visible but showed this Consultant. Consultant did not
view any bruising on the back of Youth A’s shoulder. Youth A first
reported she did not recall when Staff 1 punched her, but then
said it was a few days ago and later reported a week ago in the
afternoon after school but before dinner. Youth A reported Youth
B was the only youth present who witnessed the incident. Youth A
reported this was the first time Staff 1 ever punched her. Youth A
reported she has never witnessed or heard of Staff 1 punching
any other youth at the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/22/2025. Youth B reported Youth A unplugged the TV and Staff
1 went up and pushed Youth A in the living room. Youth B
reported she did not recall when the incident occurred however
reported it was after Christmas in the afternoon on a school day.
Youth B reported no other staff or youth witnessed the incident.
Youth B did not recall any of the other staff working the day the
incident occurred. Youth B reported Staff 1 did not say anything
when he pushed Youth A. Youth B demonstrated how Staff 1
pushed Youth A as Staff 1 used his forearm to push Youth A on
the front part of her body. Youth B reported Youth A did not say
anything when Staff 1 pushed her. Youth B reported Youth A did
not fall from the push. Youth B reported she has never seen Staff
1 push or hit any other youth in the house.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
1/22/2025. Staff 1 reported he did not recall the day/date, but he
did recall one day between the time of 2pm and 6pm, he was in
the living room and Youth A was running around playing. Staff 1
reported Youth A was running toward him, and he noticed it
2

looked like she was going to fall into him. Staff 1 reported he
turned his body sideways and put his arms out pointing down to
the side to block Youth A from falling into his knee as he is
recovering from a knee injury. Staff 1 reported Youth A ran into
his forearm with her shoulder as she stumbled. Staff 1 reported
Youth A did not say anything when she fell into his arm. Staff 1
reported Youth A constantly unplugs the TV at the facility when
she does not get to watch what she wants. Staff 1 reported no
incidents when Youth A unplugged the TV where he would have
blocked Youth A from him or ever punched her in the shoulder or
pushed her. Staff 1 reported Youth A accused him of punching
her in the shoulder when Youth A’s probation officer was at the
facility. Staff 1 reported he believed Youth A had almost fallen
into him approximately five days prior to her probation officer
coming to the facility. Staff 1 reported Youth B was in the living
room when Youth A fell toward him and Youth B was the only one
who witnessed the incident. Staff 1 reported Youth B made a
sound when it happened and described the sound as an “ugh” as
if she was offended about what happened.
Assistant Facility Administrator was interviewed face-to-face
at the facility on 1/22/2025. Assistant Facility Administrator (AFA)
reported she became aware of the allegations when Youth A
reported the incident in front of her probation officer. AFA
reported it is unclear when the alleged incident occurred however
based on Youth A and Youth B’s interviews with MDHHS Worker,
both youth report it occurred on a weekend since New Years
between the hours of 2pm and 6pm as it was light out in the
afternoon. AFA reported the only weekend since New Years Staff
1 worked was 1/11/2025 and 1/12/2025 on second shift which
starts at 2pm. AFA reported she has reviewed video footage on
1/11/2025 and 1/12/2025 from 2pm to 6pm and there was never a
time where Staff 1 hit or pushed Youth A in any way. AFA
reported she located video footage of Youth A unplugging the TV
on 1/11/2025 and 1/12/2025 however at no time was Staff 1 near
Youth A. AFA reported Youth A frequently unplugs the TV at the
facility. AFA reported she has never had any concerns with Staff
1’s interactions with any youth at the facility.
Video Reviewed:
There was no video footage found for Staff 1 punching or
pushing Youth A. The facility reviewed a ten-day period of video
footage.
Documents Reviewed:
3

• Youth opportunity New Hope Youth Center Safe Crisis
Management and Physical Intervention Policy and
Procedure: Safe Crisis Management (SCM) is the verbal
and physical intervention program trained and used by the
program staff. Prohibited Practices include any type of
physical punishment including, but not limited to: hitting or
striking youth on any part of their body.
• New Hope Youth Academy Safety Plan for Youth A and
Staff 1 signed by all staff on 1/17/2025: Youth A and Staff 1
may not be unsupervised together at any time.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had no discipline in his
personnel file. Staff 1 received Safe Crisis Management
training on 9/25/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews and lack of
video footage of the incident being found, there is not enough
information to support the incident occurred. Youth A reported
Staff 1 punched her in the shoulder however Youth B who
reportedly witnessed the incident reported Staff 1 pushed Youth A.
Staff 1 reported he never pushed or punched Youth A and the
only incident he could recall was when Youth A was running
around the living room playing and almost fell into him and he
used his forearm to bock Youth A from hitting his knee due to a
recent knee injury. Staff 1 reported he did not push Youth A with
his forearm and merely put his arm out to protect his knee.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
